resources.string: Turn on notification for rise in cases
Here are the covid statistics for...

All Covid-19 data reported in the app on the county level is from The New York Times Covid-19 data set (https://github.com/nytimes/covid-19-data) which gathers data from state and local health agencies. Any data reported on the state level is from The COVID Tracking Project from The Atlantic (https://covidtracking.com) which gathers data from state and local health agencies, as well as from official press conferences held by state authorities.

This app is designed to provide users with an overview of the Covid-19 community spread information in their area. This app uses a user\'s location to alert them of the Covid-19 status in areas they have visited or are currently visiting. This app is not designed as a contact tracing app and should not be used as such. This app is provided purely for informational purposes.
Notifies whenever entering an area with high community spread
Notifies whenever an area visited in the last 14 days has high community spread

Current Location Settings must be enabled for full functionality of this app. This app does not work without current location enabled. Current location data is only saved in the form of a FIPS code, which is a county identifier, locally on the device .

The data from the New York Times and The Atlantic was used in the calculations which generated the statistics displayed throughout the app. Data reported in this app may differ from other sources due to differences in reporting standards and reporting lag times.
